info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Chesterfield, southeastern Prince Edward, northeastern Lunenburg, Nottoway, Amelia and southern Powhatan Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Macon to near Amelia Courthouse to near Green Bay. Movement was east southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Amelia Courthouse and Macon around 620 PM EDT. Chula around 625 PM EDT. Victoria, Moseley and Scotts Fork around 630 PM EDT. Crewe and Mannboro around 635 PM EDT. Nottoway around 640 PM EDT. Blackstone around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include North Wellville, Irby, Prince Edward Station, Earls, Ammon, Pilkinton, Murdocks, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush and The Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
